label: Divine Office
description: Divine office, written in a late liturgical script on parchment--very nearly humanist in form. 2 leaves, beginning with f.170.

label: Arabic Leaf, undescribed
description: a single paper leaf in Arabic script, red and black ink.

label: Antiphonal Binding
description: Two antiphonal leaves repurposed as bindings. "Alleluyas." Written in a similar late Spanish Gothic Script as the earlier Antiphonal.

label: Charter with two seals
description: An English charter, written in an English cursiva hand on parchment. Two remaining seals attached. The names Thomas and Elizabeth are mentioned in the first line.

label: Bible - Perhaps Ege 61
description: A single leaf on very fine parchment (perhaps uterine vellum). Part of Otto Ege's Original Leaves from Famous Books: Eight Centuries.

label: Aristotle's Ethics - Ege 61
description: Single leaf on paper of Aristotle's ethics, written in a rapid hand over two columns. Part of Otto Ege's Original Leaves from Famous Books: Eight Centuries

label: Livy - Ege
description: Single leaf on parchment of Livy's History of Rome, written in a humanist hand. Part of the choir stitching still visible on the upper right. Part of Otto Ege's Original Leaves from Famous Books: Eight Centuries

label: Antiphonal - Alleluia
description: An "Alleluia" for the fifth Sunday after Pentecost: "O Lord, the king rejoices in Your Strength; he greatly exults in Your aid. Alleluia." Written in a sixteenth-century Spanish Gothic Script (Iberian Textualis Formata Rotunda) on parchment. Note the disconnected a and the flat descenders as key markers of script style. 1 sheet, marked f. 113.
